There is increasing recognition of manifestations of neurological disease, reported in 36% of ICU patients in a series from Wuhan with severe respiratory disease.
35 The most common presentation in the ICU setting is delirium, which, although well reported in intensive care syndrome itself,
36 appears to be even more common in COVID-19 ICU patients.
37 Delirium may be associated with the primary disease itself, or may result from the combinations of drug therapy used for sedation in prolonged ventilation, particularly when neuromuscular blocking agents are required to facilitate mechanical ventilation.
